column4: Can anyone help me work out why I am getting this error when trying to sudo mount -a:   "mount error 20 = Not a directory"
probably typo in /etc/fstab file? Since mount -a mounts all filesystems mentioned in /etc/fstab, using the arguments specified in that file
ocean:   don't think so. My fstab says: //10.1.1.16/media1  /media/media1  cifs username=guest,password=,uid=1000,iocharset=utf8,codepage=unicode,unicode  0  0
perl - nope
to verify that the error is (or isn't) on that line, you might want to try "mount -t cifs -a"
oCean - still get the error
ah.. what are you trying to mount?
an smb shared nas drive
ok, and *your* directory /media/media1 exists?
yep...
hmmm.. cifs module is loaded? (lsmod | grep cif)
oCean: response is "cifs                  259984  0"
oke, so it *is* loaded. Hmmm...
oCean Yup. I think it is to do wth user ids and permissions.  But there are no passwords set on the drive itself
oke, in your options you specify password= Since you're not using that, pls try mounting without that option?
oCean: will do. I tried that before though. following this link: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MountWindowsSharesPermanently
oC: change FSTAB to //10.1.1.16/media1  /media/media1  cifs uid=1000,iocharset=utf8,codepage=unicode,unicode  0  0     yields same results
- what location?
well, I'm running out of options then..
oCean - yeah, me too. Tis wierd.
there's one more thing you might want to try. A long-shot maybe.... Try "echo 0 > /proc/fs/cifs/LinuxExtensionsEnabled" (It's probably 1 right now)
